017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.svg;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.SVGUtils.number;
023
024import org.apiguardian.api.API;
025import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
026import org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGNumber;
027import org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type.SVGNumber.SVGUserUnitValue;
028
029/**
030 *  The definition for the SVG {@code <rect>} element.
031 *
032 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
033 *  @version $Id: SVGRectangle.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $
034 *  @since 0.0.5
035 *
036 *  @UMLGraph.link
037 */
038@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SVGRectangle.java 820 2020-12-29 20:34:22Z tquadrat $" )
039@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
040public sealed interface SVGRectangle extends SVGElementWithChildren, AllowsConditionalProcessingAttributes, AllowsGlobalEventAttributes, AllowsGraphicalEventAttributes, AllowsPresentationAttributes, AllowsStyleAttributes permits SVGElementAdapter, org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.internal.SVGRectangleImpl
041{
042        /*---------*\
043    ====** Methods **==========================================================
044        \*---------*/
045    /**
046     *  Sets the start and end points for this line.
047     *
048     *  @param  x   The x coordinate for the upper left corner of the
049     *      rectangle.
050     *  @param  y  The y coordinate for the upper left corner of the
051     *      rectangle.
052     *  @param  width   The width of the rectangle.
053     *  @param  height  The height of the rectangle.
054     */
055    public default void defineRectangle( final SVGNumber x, final SVGNumber y, final SVGNumber width, final SVGNumber height )
056    {
057        setX( requireNonNullArgument( x, "x" ) );
058        setY( requireNonNullArgument( y, "y" ) );
059        setWidth( requireNonNullArgument( width, "width" ) );
060        setHeight( requireNonNullArgument( height, "height" ) );
061    }   //  defineLine()
062
063    /**
064     *  Sets the height for this SVG {@code <rect>} element.
065     *
066     *  @param  value   The height.
067     */
068    public void setHeight( final SVGNumber value );
069
070    /**
071     *  Sets the length of the path represented by this SVG {@code <rect>}
072     *  element.
073     *
074     *  @param  length  The author's computation of the total length of the
075     *      path, in user units. This type is used to calibrate the user
076     *      agent's own distance-along-a-path calculations with that of the
077     *      author. The user agent will scale all distance-along-a-path
078     *      computations by the ratio of this type to the user agent's own
079     *      computed type for total path length.<br>
080     *      <br>A type of zero is valid, but a negative type is an error.
081     *
082     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The type is less than 0.
083     */
084    public void setPathLength( final SVGUserUnitValue length );
085
086    /**
087     *  Sets the length of the path represented by this SVG {@code <rect>}
088     *  element.
089     *
090     *  @param  length  The author's computation of the total length of the
091     *      path, in user units. This type is used to calibrate the user
092     *      agent's own distance-along-a-path calculations with that of the
093     *      author. The user agent will scale all distance-along-a-path
094     *      computations by the ratio of this type to the user agent's own
095     *      computed type for total path length.<br>
096     *      <br>A type of zero is valid, but a negative type is an error.
097     *
098     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The type is less than 0.
099     */
100    public default void setPathLength( final double length ) { setPathLength( number( length ) ); }
101
102    /**
103     *  Sets the length of the path represented by this SVG {@code <rect>}
104     *  element.
105     *
106     *  @param  length  The author's computation of the total length of the
107     *      path, in user units. This type is used to calibrate the user
108     *      agent's own distance-along-a-path calculations with that of the
109     *      author. The user agent will scale all distance-along-a-path
110     *      computations by the ratio of this type to the user agent's own
111     *      computed type for total path length.<br>
112     *      <br>A type of zero is valid, but a negative type is an error.
113     *
114     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The type is less than 0.
115     */
116    public default void setPathLength( final long length ) { setPathLength( number( length ) ); }
117
118    /**
119     *  Sets the horizontal corner radius for this SVG {@code <rect>} element.
120     *
121     *  @param  value   The horizontal corner radius.
122     */
123    public void setRx( final SVGNumber value );
124
125    /**
126     *  Sets the vertical corner radius for this SVG {@code <rect>} element.
127     *
128     *  @param  value   The vertical corner radius.
129     */
130    public void setRy( final SVGNumber value );
131
132    /**
133     *  Sets the width for this SVG {@code <rect>} element.
134     *
135     *  @param  value   The width.
136     */
137    public void setWidth( final SVGNumber value );
138
139    /**
140     *  Sets the x coordinate for the upper left corner of the rectangle.
141     *
142     *  @param  value   The x coordinate.
143     */
144    public void setX( final SVGNumber value );
145
146    /**
147     *  Sets the y coordinate for the upper left corner of the rectangle.
148     *
149     *  @param  value   The y coordinate.
150     */
151    public void setY( final SVGNumber value );
152}
153//  interface SVGRectangle
154
155/*
156 *  End of File
157 */
